item.title: Boris Johnson outlines new 1.25% health and social care tax to pay for reforms
item.description: Boris Johnson says it is a "responsible decision", but Labour calls the plan a "sticking plaster".

item.title: Sophie Moss death: Sam Pybus jailed for choking woman
item.description: Sophie Moss, a mother of two boys, was found unconscious at her flat and later died in hospital.

item.title: Covid: Unvaccinated frontline NHS staff at Southampton hospital to be redeployed
item.description: Southampton trust says it wants to keep patients safe but one staff member says she feels "bullied".

item.title: Colchester rapper death: Two guilty of murder
item.description: Alinjavwa Siwale, 22, also known as Swizzino, was stabbed to death in his own home.

item.title: Brinsworth Academy: Rotherham teenager seriously injured in school attack
item.description: Police say two 16-year-old boys were arrested in connection with incident at Brinsworth Academy.

item.title: CCTV records car driving down Birmingham railway tracks
item.description: Police say the act has resulted in damage to the railway totalling more than Â£23,000.

item.title: Whitehaven coal mine: Planning inquiry risks being 'hijacked'
item.description: The planning inspectorate is told objections to the scheme amount to "emissions offshoring".

item.title: Sarah Harding helps fund breast cancer research for women in 30s
item.description: Money raised by the late Girls Aloud star will fund research into cancer among women in their 30s.

item.title: Kelly Jefferies: Mum missing with son may have changed hair
item.description: Kelly Jefferies went missing with 10-year-old Knox after care proceedings started.

item.title: London Underground: Man died after falling into gap, RAIB finds
item.description: He fell between the train and the platform while alighting and was not seen by the driver.

item.title: Wareham Forest: More heathland destroyed as fire breaks out
item.description: A devastating blaze destroyed more than 550 acres (220 hectares) of the forest last year.

item.title: 'Why not have festivals that only women can attend?'
item.description: The idea for the three-day LBTQ Femme Fest was conceived on social media during lockdown.

item.title: Meteor caught on camera over Southampton docks
item.description: The shooting star was captured on camera over Southampton docks on Sunday night.

item.title: Should Whitehaven's planned coal mine be allowed?
item.description: Whitehaven residents share their thoughts on what could become the UK's first deep mine in 30 years.

item.title: London's unemployment situation explained
item.description: Why is the capital's unemployment rate is higher than the rest of the UK?

item.title: 'I hid my litter picker in my suitcase'
item.description: Jenny I'Anson, 73, says she can spend up to five hours a day clearing rubbish.

item.title: Andover A303 crash: Tributes to three killed in crash
item.description: Tina Ince, Alex Britton and Tom Watson died in the four-vehicle crash near Andover.

item.title: Brenda Venables: Husband denies Kempsey septic tank murder
item.description: David Venables faces trial following the discovery of wife Brenda's remains 37 years after disappearing.

item.title: Dozens more migrants cross English Channel in small boats
item.description: Weather conditions have become more favourable for those making the journey.

item.title: Only Fools and Horses star John Challis cancels tour due to ill health
item.description: Herefordshire actor John Challis' tour is cancelled due to ill health, promoters say.

item.title: Bournemouth Air Festival crash pilot and wing-walker 'returning to work'
item.description: Pilot David Barrell and wing-walker Kirsten Pobjoy suffered minor injuries at Bournemouth air show.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: How many medals did your region win?
item.description: At this year's Paralympics the North West of England and East Midlands tied for the most gold medals.

item.title: Redcar speedway racer from Norfolk retrieves stolen bikes
item.description: Ryan Kinsley's three bikes and equipment worth up to Â£20,000 were stolen from outside a hotel.

item.title: George Russell: Mercedes sign British F1 driver to partner Lewis Hamilton from 2022
item.description: Mercedes announce British driver George Russell will partner Lewis Hamilton from next season.

item.title: US Open: Why it is right to be excited about 'wise' & 'fearless' Emma Raducanu
item.description: As British teenager Emma Raducanu reaches the US Open quarter-finals, BBC Sport looks at why it is right to be excited by her journey.

item.title: Ben Stokes: England will make late decision over T20 World Cup squad
item.description: England will make a late decision over all-rounder Ben Stokes' place in the T20 World Cup squad, set to be named on Thursday.

item.title: 'We can't let our guard down' - Southgate warns against England complacency
item.description: England boss Gareth Southgate knows his side cannot become complacent as they look to maintain their 100% record in World Cup qualifying when they face Poland on Wednesday.
